definition: to overlook/to look down at
to look down/to stoop
variant of 俯[fu3]
to look at/to regard/to inspect
old variant of 視|视[shi4]
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]

sentences.english: Eg. The house on the hill overlooks the village.
sentences.chinese: 从小山上的房子可以俯视村庄。

sentences.english: The turning direction of this water turbine is overlook clockwise.
sentences.chinese: 水轮机旋向为俯视顺时针。

sentences.english: Overlooking this piece of place, let a person feel there is worthy of the fairy tale world.
sentences.chinese: 俯视这片地方，让人感觉那里是名副其实的童话世界。

sentences.english: Top view of chamfered washer or spacer with adjustable inside and outside diameters.
sentences.chinese: 内径和外径都可调整的有切角的垫圈或垫片的俯视图。

sentences.english: Drigung monastery is on a steep hill, overlooking our camp.
sentences.chinese: 止贡寺位于陡峭的山上，俯视着我们的营地。

sentences.english: The statue stared down at them with sightless eyes.
sentences.chinese: 雕像用一双盲眼俯视着他们。

sentences.english: The great kings look down on us from those stars.
sentences.chinese: 伟大的君王们正从星星上俯视我们。

sentences.english: Fushi" means to look down at, or overlook."
sentences.chinese: “俯视”的意思就是从高处往下看。

sentences.english: Their room was on the third floor, its window overlooking the sportsground.
sentences.chinese: 他们的房间在三层楼上，窗户俯视着操场。

sentences.english: We can overlook the city garden from our balcony.
sentences.chinese: 从我们的阳台上就可以俯视城市花园。

sentences.english: She's looking down on the continued bustling activity of the main terminal concourse .
sentences.chinese: 她俯视候机主楼大厅里持续的熙熙攘攘的活动。

sentences.english: A pair on patrol and one at high altitude on overwatch.
sentences.chinese: 一对在巡逻的时候另外一个在高空俯视。

sentences.english: Far below the plane we could see the lights of London.
sentences.chinese: 从飞机上俯视远处可以看到伦敦的万家灯火。

sentences.english: He was on a wide ledge overlooking the valley.
sentences.chinese: 他是在俯视谷的一个宽壁架。

sentences.english: Overlooking the land of flying Christmas video.

definition: to overlook/to look down from a height
to tilt one's head back to see (sth)/to look up at
to live high and look down (idiom)/to overlook/to tower above/to occupy the high ground/fig. arrogance based on one's social position
to look up at/to look up to sb hopefully
to get a bird's-eye view/bird's-eye view/broad overview
to look disdainfully out of the corner of one's eye
to survey the scene from an elevated position
to gaze into the distance
to look into the distance
to take in the whole scene at once/to have a panoramic view
high place/elevation
to stand tall/to tower aloft
summit
to gaze afar/to look into the distance
tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
as far as the eye can see
